projects.description: This is my first project on the Techdegree. I practiced my knowledge of basic JavaScript syntax and data structures by building a Random Quote Generator, a program that displays a randomly selected quote each time the user clicks a button. I worked with JavaScript arrays, objects and functions.

Displaying a long list of items on a web page, like a list of 200 movie titles or 400 products, can overwhelm a user with too much information at once. A common solution is to display a handful of items on one page and provide navigation to jump to a list of more items. In this project, I wrote JavaScript to divide a long list into a series of "pages" and improve the user experience of a web page. I also added a search bar feature.

People use forms to collect information from users for many websites and applications. For this project, I used my skills to enhance a form so that it’s engaging, interactive, and easy to use.  I also made the form more user-friendly by providing helpful error messages when the user enters invalid information into the form fields.

I created a browser-based, word guessing game: "Phrase Hunter." I used JavaScript and OOP (Object-Oriented Programming) to create this game. A player tries to guess the phrase by selecting individual letters from an onscreen keyboard or the computer's keyboard. They have to guess the phrase before they run out of attempts.

Many sites — Twitter, Facebook, IMDB, and Wikipedia to name a few — offer a vast sea of data that I can access and display on my own web pages. Using JavaScript, I created an employee directory by communicating with a third-party API (Application Programming Interface).

React is one of the most popular development libraries on the web, which is why React developers are in such great demand. So I improved my  skills and got some valuable practice and experience by using React and the handy Create React App tool to build a fast and lightweight gallery app with a modern approach.

Working with databases — storing, retrieving, updating and deleting information — is an important software developer skill. In this project, I created a web application for listing, adding, updating, and deleting books in a library application, using JavaScript, Node.js, Express, Pug, and the SQL ORM Sequelize.

React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. React makes building and maintaining the user interface of my application faster and easier by breaking it up into smaller, reusable components. It also helps eliminate the complexity that comes with updating my DOM elements when the user interacts with my application.

This special app uses the localStorage object. Any invitee you put in the app will be saved in your browser but not on the server. The data will not be deleted when the browser is closed and will be available forever until you delete it. To see my project with data that gets saved to a server check out https://www.noahschade.ca/project/5

projects.project_name: Advanced CSS and Sass Landing Page
projects.description: In this project I learned advanced CSS and Sass. I learned a lot of new CSS properties, techniques and features. I learned more animations in CSS, advanced responsive design, SASS architecture, a lot of cool CSS effects, and much more.
image_urls: ../images/Advanced CSS and Sass Landing Page/Advanced CSS and Sass Landing Page main page.png

projects.description: In this project I learned how to use Flexbox in CSS and Sass. I also learned about custom CSS properties, masks and SVGs.
In this project I learned how to use Grid in CSS and Sass.

This app has a signup, sign in, sign out, deactivate account feature. It has email verification, password protection, image uploading, account information editing, search, follow, adding likes, and a publishing notes feature. It also allows you to see the number of notes you have posted, the number of followers you have, the number of people you are following, and the number of profile views you have. It allows you to see which users are following you and which users you are following.

This app has a signup, sign in, sign out, deactivate account feature. It has email verification, password protection, image uploading, account information editing, search, follow, adding likes, and a posting feature. It also allows you to see your number of posts, the number of followers you have, the number of people you are following, the number of recommendations you have, and the number of profile views you have. It allows you to see which users are following you, which users you are following, and what are the recommendations you have. It has notifications, groups, favorites, an image gallery, bookmarks, messaging, and an explore feature, and much more.
